page.title: 19NORTH EAST OF SUTTON VILLAGE
page.content:
The area to the North-East of{Sutton {Village}is mainly covered with coniferous trees and heathland.
Some of the woodland is cultivated for commercial purposes and is cut down every ten years. This is owned by{Broxtead House.
Between the{American Base}and {Broxtead House}is a very large Sewage Works which services the houses of the{U.S.A.F Base.}It is about a kilometre from the perimeter fence of the Base.
The{California plantation,}stretching for three-quarters of a kilometre, and{Gyb Hill}plantation shields the Sewage Works from the main road to {Sutton Village.
